page.title: 09BOXTED PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Boxted has an attractive village school built in 1837,and situated right next to the church .The school has a play ground,a playing field and an area of wooded land on two sides. The children do a good deal of nature study in the woods.The church is used for special school services during the year.There are 93 children on roll and they are divided in to three classes, ages range from 5_11 yrs. They have two re_locatable classrooms outside so one of the larger rooms inside can be used for P.E. and other activities, including watching the T.V. and morning Assembly. They start school at 9am and some children who live 2 miles away are brought in a school bus.The day ends at 3:00pm. Some children go home at midday for a meal,some bring sandwiches or have cooked meals.
